Fields.DialogueText: Good morning, Miss Arizona. How's the day treating you?
Can't complain, Captain - but look at you!
It's hotter than a saddle laid out in the sun! What's with the heavy clothes?

Fields.MenuText: It's important that the commander of the ship look the role at all times, Miss Arizona.
This is the clothing all captains wear while on duty, Miss Arizona.
I refuse to let the heat beat me, Miss Arizona. This is a contest of wills between me and the sun.

Fields.DialogueText: Heat strokes are nothing to knock at, Captain. They certainly don't care for your leadership position.
There's a thin line between fashion and suffering, and it appears you enjoy straddling it, Captain.
You really ought to go to the infirmary, Captain. Seriously. Heat stroke may already be setting in.
Morgana sighted, Captain!
Slide over, Slick! I wanna see them over the railing too!
Get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Phew! Nothing like a good workout before we get serious! Bring on the real fight!
Ma'am... I'm pretty sure you sent any remaining Morganas running for the figurative hills.
Darn! Maybe we'll have a little more fun next time, then!
Water! Get your ice cold water here!
A literal goddess! It must be a mirage!
Shucks! Y'all know how to light the brimstone under a gal's cheeks!
Oh! Captain! Please make way, gents! I'll get back to y'all shortly!
Here's a premium for you, sailor! Take it while it's not hot! Hee hee!

Fields.MenuText: Not to sound ungrateful, but there's barely any ice left in this glass, Miss Arizona.
Thank you very much for the drink, Miss Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: Miracles are a dime a dozen, Captain! Sometimes the oasis is but a foul-smelling pond in the desert!
I ain't a superdreadnought for nothing, Captain! Though an ice-cream machine sure would be nice to have installed!
Ooo! Silent but appreciative! Like a lone cowboy nursing his gin before a high noon showdown!
Wouldn't that be a sight?
*BOOM*
Tarnation! Are they STILL shooting at us? Those Morganas ain't good at takin' hints!
Maybe you should have delivered the water after battle, Ma'am?
Nonsense! I need you refreshed if we're going to put on a show!
@BATTLE
See what I mean? No drama! No engaging life or death struggle! What a disappointment!
Your keen sense of the theatrical is really something else, Miss Arizona...
*YAWN*
My apologies for that slip, Captain! The 'Lantic is just so boring when en route to Europe.
I know it's important to show those Redcoats that we got their backs, but even still...

Fields.MenuText: Let's have a little bit more respect for your British cousins, Miss Arizona.
Redcoats. That's a word I don't hear very often.
Even as a joke, that's a little bit tasteless, Miss Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! My apologies, Captain! I was just trying to make light with some old fashioned humor!
Yeah. Reckon fashion ain't exactly top priority anymore when it comes to military dress over there.
No offense meant, Captain. Boredom tends to bring out the worst in people.

Fields.MenuText: You don't say.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey! This outfit is form fitting AND pretty darn adorable, I reckon!

Fields.MenuText: I see. Well, if this is your worst I can't really complain, Miss Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: Nah... that would be my choir voice...
Can it take a shell?
Looks like we've got Morganas. See if you can't give them an earful.
Hey!
@BATTLE
Nah, it's just clothes. But whatever hit me, I reckon I'd still be standing.
... Hey, don't get any indecent ideas, now!
What did I say?
Looks like it's all going smoothly...
Mm-hmm.
Quite the haul we're bringing in on our little wagon. Well, maybe not that little.
Kind of wish we could bring horses on board, though.

Fields.MenuText: Horses wouldn't do well on the ship, Miss Arizona.
Hard to ride horses out in the open sea, I'm afraid.

Fields.DialogueText: Texas does all right with 'em! Even came with one when she awoke.
I reckon you're right, Captain. There's no place to mount turrets on them either!
... M-my apologies for bringing up such a joke, Captain. I wasn't serious or nothin'!
You didn't. Let's leave it at that.
I can never tell when you're joking or serious, Miss Arizona...
It's hard to tell with you sometimes, Miss Arizona.
I guess I should learn to hogtie my tongue.
@BATTLE
Stay loose. We've got company!
What are you reading there, Miss Arizona?
Oh! Captain! I'm reading the script from this new play called "Thunder Rock!"
Oh? I heard it didn't do too well on Broadway...

Fields.MenuText: Are you interested in reading plays, Miss Arizona?
Are you interested in acting, Miss Arizona?
It's funny. The play was dismissed for calling for intervention, but now we're starting to take action against the Morgana fleet instead.

Fields.DialogueText: Gosh. Well, I've always wanted to see one, but reading is the best I can do in my situation.
You're darn tootin' I am! Of course, I've had my time on the silver screen, but performing in front of a live audience, on stage? That's what I really want to do.
Ah! Don't tell me too much, Captain! I only started reading it!
Right... you can't physically walk too far from the ship.
You've been in movies?
Ah, how little you know about me, Captain.
Ah. My apologies.
@BATTLE
Morganas. We'll have to talk theater later.
YEE-HAW! JUST LIKE A ROUND-UP!
You should really put that lasso away, Ma'am!
SADDLE UP, FOLKS! WE'RE GOING STRAIGHT FOR THE BULL'S NEST!
Bulls don't NEST, Miss Arizona!!
@BATTLE
Tarnation! That was actually something! Almost a challenge!

Fields.MenuText: The adrenaline was certainly pumping when we decided to go all in, Miss Arizona.
We really do need to have a talk at some point about recklessness and bulls' nests, Miss Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: I know!
We were hardly in danger of being trampled, Captain. I made sure we would be able to back our horses up in the event of anything going south.
Captain... you don't have to give me the ol' cold shoulder...
Imagine if we had taken more damage...
What kind of rodeo doesn't get the blood pumping?! Pony it up, boys!
I'd rather avoid bleeding out if at all possible, Miss Arizona...
Granted. You DID wait until conditions were optimal...
Last thing any Belle would want is a situation where tunnel vision gets the best of us in battle.
Glad to hear it.
I made sure that we had a way out before charging in like that, but I understand if you're upset that I didn't say anything to better reassure you...
I'll go apologize to the boys for my behavior, Captain.
*ALARM*
Captain!
We got company, and it ain't the kind you invite in for pie!
Now there's an image...
@BATTLE
So hot...! Why does it have to be so much worse after battle? These guns just constantly radiate heat...
Drink up, now, and be glad you ain't on a Japanese ship!

Fields.MenuText: Why do you say that?
Any particular reason you're poking fun at your Neutrality Fleet ally?
Here we go again...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Captain, you should hear what they get up to over in the Kawasaki shipyard!
I heard you can literally fry an egg anywhere inside of that aircraft carrier, Kaga, since it's hot as the dickens from her funnels being laid on her sides!
That... that sounds kind of uncomfortable for living quarters.
Living like a cactus in the desert, I'll say! At least the desert has more ventilation!
Well, where I come from, we get it right the first time!
That might have been true five years ago. She's had some upgrades since then.
Hmm. I bet the blueprints and whatnot from your modernization would be interesting reading.
C-Captain! You don't just say that kind of thing! It's--
Indecent?
... Mhm. I see what you mean.
Gather round the water cooler, fellas! There's enough to go around!
I'm so glad I was assigned to this ship! *sniffs*
This ain't the time for tears, boy! Gotta keep you guys in tip-top shape if we're to be saddled up together!
Here's your glass, Captain. Still got a sliver of ice floating in it too!

Fields.MenuText: Quite the iceberg you saved for me in this glass, Miss Arizona.
Thank you for always showing our crew such kindness, Miss Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: Not enough to cripple ocean liners, but I'd reckon it's a good indicator that your water ain't half bad in this heat!
Aww, shucks! It ain't nothing, Captain! I can only do what I can to help out where I'm needed most. You fellas are the wind in my sails, after all!
Glad you're enjoying your drink, Captain. You can thank me later!
All the more reason to appreciate you, then.
Who else needs water?
Enemy vessels spotted!
Break's over, fellas! Let me get these glasses secure. We need to be gettin' those damn Morganas off our property!
@BATTLE
Is Shakespeare really a good way to start learning how to act on stage, Captain?
Not a fan?
It's not that! It's just...
I mean... I've read a bit of Hamlet before, but I found that to be mighty difficult to read in front of others.

Fields.MenuText: What would you prefer?
You've read Hamlet? I wouldn't have thought that was your kind of thing.
Shakespeare's works are classics! They're always a good starting point for those new to stage.

Fields.DialogueText: How bout some Edgar Allen Poe? The Cask of Amontillado has two speakers in it. We could trade off!
Don't judge a gal from the way she looks, Captain! Especially not a superdreadnought!
Oh? You don't say. Hmm. Maybe I should consider giving his works another go-through. I'll have someone fetch some books the next time we are in port!
I'll... think about it. You a big Poe fan, then?
Aw, sure. Who isn't? Oh, or we could do stories from the Navajo!
Stories with unseen forces compelling the characters, or the terror of humanity's most suppressed feelings and thoughts!
You really are an odd one, aren't you?
Heh heh!
That wasn't exactly what I was getting at...
Once you get used to the language, I think you'll really get into it.
Glad to hear it!
@BATTLE
"Who's there?"
Morganas, Captain! Keep up, why don't you?
No, it's from... Never mind.
What is wrong with these rattlesnakes?! Does self-preservation mean nothin' to 'em?
You'd be surprised, Miss Arizona!
We're lucky that it's not a full-on gale that's whipping us back and forth in these waves!
Get ready for a roundup, fellas! Let's blow them to kingdom come!
@BATTLE
That should have scared them off.
If they ain't scrap at the bottom of the sea, I reckon.

Fields.MenuText: You look a bit shaken up, Miss Arizona.
Are you hurt, Miss Arizona?
Well, this was a good reminder to keep aware of our surroundings.

Fields.DialogueText: Even experienced bull riders get shaken up once and awhile, Captain. Square dancing is easy when you aren't dancing with death.
Huh? No, I reckon I'm doing pretty well, considering everything that happened. I think a short nap will help get me back on track, Captain.
I'll be sure to reflect on that while I lie down for a bit, Captain. I'll be in my cabin if you need me.
Perhaps some tea will help soothe your nerves.
I would mighty appreciate that, Captain.
You're free to nap, Miss Arizona. Take care.
You're getting more confident with your stage voice, Miss Arizona! I think Mr. Poe is helping.
I still keep stuttering from time to time though, Captain. It's so embarrassing...
Don't lower your hat in shame, Miss Arizona. Let's move on to the next part, shall we?
All right...
Enemy patrol spotted, Captain!
Looks like we'll put this off for later, Miss Arizona!
Perfect time to work out my frustration on something big and dumb!
@BATTLE
Phew. Them Morganas never knew what they had coming! I feel much better now!

Fields.MenuText: Want to continue?
It's best we return to our stage practice.
I'll get the book.

Fields.DialogueText: Whew. Yes, please!
You won't hear me arguin'.
Thanks, Captain.
Whoever would have thought that a battle would have been such an effective way to blow off steam?
Let's start where we left off.
Roger!
Aw, heck!
Captain! We've got a whole lot of ugly on our tail!
Right. Let's reorient before they get in firing range...
@BATTLE
Nothing beats iced tea right after battle, Captain. Especially after a good reading session!
You very much deserve it. You worked hard work today.
Don't mention it, Captain! Theatre, both battle and for the stage, is tougher than it looks.

Fields.MenuText: Why do you want to do theatre so badly? You know you can't ever go far from the docks.
Acting is just a hobby for you, right? You're putting in so much effort I'm starting to wonder.
As good as having a hobby is, don't forget to train for battle too.

Fields.DialogueText: I find it to be good stress relief, even if reading out loud does cause me anxiety.
Aw, I'm well aware of my limitations, Captain. I just hope that I might someday prove entertaining to the fellas on board the ship.
I can hogtie both tasks with ease, Captain. Of that, I am confident.
I see. It's good to have a hobby, especially with how restricted you Belles are when trying to move outside of the ship.
Fair enough. Keep your chin up, Miss Arizona.
Mmm! What a nice breeze! Makes it feel less humid, doesn't it, Captain?
If the deck wasn't made of wood, I would propose we build a fire to grill some fish.
We'll have to save that sort of spirit for when we've got a dock to work with, Miss Arizona.
I'm certain it would raise everyone's spirits! Especially with spirits!

Fields.MenuText: Let's not speak of alcohol right now, Miss Arizona. I feel my throat getting parched as we speak.
You're not talking about bringing ghosts aboard the ship, Miss Arizona...
Heh. I think the last thing I ever want to see is you drunk, Miss Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, heh! Perhaps I'll go wrassle us some glasses of water in the meantime, then!
Of course not, Captain! But a ghost story by the fire is a pretty traditional thing to do!
Hey, now! I can hold my liquor, Captain! Superdreadnoughts can drink you under the table!
Please do. That would be wonderful.
Fair enough. I just try not to take things for granted these days.
That's a premise I'm in no hurry to test.
Looks like some Morganas are here for a rodeo, Captain!
Let's go round them up!
@BATTLE
So. Captain...
Hm?
I was wondering if you would be interested in allowing me to set up a small stage when we get to port, so the fellas and I could do a bit of a show?

Fields.MenuText: What brought this on?
Why?
Eh. Why not?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, we have been practicing for a while.
What do you mean, why? Why not?
Thanks, Captain!
I figured we could do a little show on the docks for the workers.
Some of the crew members want in - they'd like to do comedy routines and such.
Well, now...  I think I could get behind something like that.
Thank you, Captain! It'll knock your boots off!
@BATTLE
If the Morganas don't steal them first...
Th-there is n-no way that MY h-husband would seek such debaucherous acts with t-that woman!
Psst! Relax, Miss Arizona! You're doing great!
Keep it up!

Fields.MenuText: Your husband is a sinner, Peridot!
Your husband dances with the devil in the pale moonlight, Peridot! Can you not see the stains of sin on his skin?!
Your husband is a true gentleman, and I am but a poor fool, eager for love, Peridot.

Fields.DialogueText: NO! I refuse to believe these accusations! He is a good, kind man!
How DARE YOU, Sir Laurence?! He is MY HUSBAND! MY SWORN LOVE!
Oh! Your words bring tears to my eyes, Sir Laurence, but I am sworn to my husband by honor and by law!
*CHEERS* That's it, Arizona! *APPLAUSE*
Have you SHAMED YOURSELF ENOUGH, SIR LAURENCE?!
If only you could see the love I have for you, Peridot!
Away with you, foul wordsmith! Never return!
DRAW YOUR SWORD, FOR I SHALL NOT ACCEPT THIS SLIGHT!
Go, Arizona! *APPLAUSE*
Peridot! I SHALL SHOW YOU THE WRONGS OF YOUR THINKING AND TAKE YOUR LOVE FOR MYSELF!
COME AT ME, THEN!
Run away with me, Peridot! We can love each other free from aching oaths and vows best never made!
S-sir Laurence...!
*SOB* It's so beautiful!
@BATTLE
Damn it! This wasn't in the script...
HA HA! Your tyranny ends here, foul monsters from the deep!
Prepare to be struck down and rendered helpless under our might!
Captain! What say you to our enemies, before we send them back to their makers?!

Fields.MenuText: May your gods be kind because you shall find nothing but despair under our guns!
I have no words for filth like the Morganas.
You come gunning to our town, wrecking all in your path, and expect mercy? You just walked into a showdown you can't possibly win.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit!
Pony it up, boys! READY?! AIM...
I think it's high noon, Captain.
Ready?
FIRE!
FIRE!
Ha! Draw!
... This really isn't what they told me to expect at the Naval Academy.
@BATTLE
Improv. Roll with it.
Captain?
I know it's a hot day for a shootout, but...
I know, I know. There's no point in complaining.
Let's just sink these damn things.
@BATTLE
Boy howdy, that was some scramble we got thrown into today, Captain.
Look at how exhausted these fellas are. Doesn't help with the sun beating down on us like always.

Fields.MenuText: Exhausted? Maybe I should be having these out-of-shape rats run some laps if one battle wears them out.
They worked hard today. In this neverending fight against the Morganas, they deserve a break from time to time.
Adrenaline is a hell of a drug to come down from, even with this oppressive heat.

Fields.DialogueText: Tarnation, Captain! Even the best cowboys know not to overwork their trusted steeds!
Thanks for helping me carry the empty glasses, Captain. It's much more efficient to hydrate everyone on deck and collect the glasses at the same time with a partner by my side.
That's why some of the guys do laps on the deck right after battle. I've done a lap or two beside them after rough ones here and there.
That's why you're so inclined to spend hours making sure everyone gets a glass of water above deck after battle, right?
Cornered by the snake, I'll say! Was it that obvious?
Heh heh. That's a new one for the book.
There's a book? You'll have to show me it sometime, Captain!
Sure thing.
You look out for everyone's health, Miss Arizona. It's the least I could do to encourage such behavior.
Glad to see my morale efforts are approved by the sheriff.
Indeed. The high seas *are* kind of like the Wild West these days, aren't they?
We do our best to keep the peace.
You're the best deputy a sheriff could ever ask for.
Aww, shucks.
They just keep coming for water when you bring up the tray stacks. Like horses to the watering hole?
That, or tired cowboys coming into the saloon after gathering the livestock on the range.
I'd rather compare them to the cowboys than the steeds.
So, what about your drink, deputy?
Sheriff! What kind of deputy would I be if I neglected my own needs? One quick drink - and then it's off to work!
You battleships got a problem with our shows?! Firing on our convoys is NOT how to hold proper discussion out in these parts!
You want a showdown?! We'll leave your corpses for the vultures!
YEAH!
Such spirit today! Let's give them a taste of our talents, crew!
@BATTLE
Slink back to the deep end, vipers!
I think we've earned a bit of a break.
ARE YOU SAYIN' WHAT I THINK YOU'RE SAYIN', CAPTAIN?!
Yeah. And I'm glad you're excited about it.
But, boy, you can really shout when you put your mind to it.
YEEHAW! THE CAPTAIN IS LETTING US CONTINUE THE SHOW ON THE DECKS, BOYS!
GRAB A QUICK DRINK AND MEET ME AT THE BOW IN ONE HOUR!
Our last short was pretty impressive, Captain. It's gonna be hard to top the tragic love-hate story of Lady Peridot and Sir Laurence.
Maybe instead of continuing that story, we should make a brand new one.
I'm game.
What genre are you thinkin'?

Fields.MenuText: How about a western? Don't have to make you a costume, in that case.
How about a fantasy story? With dragons and the like?
How about a love story?

Fields.DialogueText: Shucks, Captain. Ever the pragmatist!
Ooo! That'll be something fun to make! Could I write the dragon's lines?
Weren't our last two entries a love story, though?
We're going to make the dragon a talking character?
Having the two romantic interests duel each other to the death is anything but romantic, Miss Arizona...
All right. Let's give it a go!
Enemy spotted, Captain!
Let's resume after we take care of these interlopers!
Roger, Captain!
@BATTLE
Oh gosh...! S-so many p-p-people...!
I guess word of our last shows got around. More dock workers are coming in on their days off and bringing their families with.
This is incredible, Miss Arizona! Even the dock workers are interested in signing up to take part as well!
I-If it m-m-makes everyone h-happy...!

Fields.MenuText: Come with me, Miss Arizona. The show isn't until we make port, so let's get some practice in.
Let's get some water on the ship and practice a few lines you've been having trouble with. The show isn't until we make port anyway.
I feel the nerves starting to get to me as well, Miss Arizona. How about a light jog on the deck of the ship and a glass of iced tea afterwards to calm ourselves?

Fields.DialogueText: I would be much obliged, Captain. That might be a nice place to practice, over there..
An-anything is better than s-s-standing around here, C-captain! M-my legs feel like they're going through r-rigor mortis.
T-that would be g-great, Captain! Last thing a rider n-needs before b-bull riding is a case of th-the nerves!
We've got some RSVPs for the next show, Arizona. And those are just the reserved seats - doesn't count standing room.
Well, this ought to get some stress out. Let's clear our way to the stage, shall we?
@BATTLE
Ain't no Morganas crashing our show!
Need help, Sailor?!
Yes, Ma'am! We need to get the artillery guns tied down, but the waves aren't making it easy!
Saddle up, cowboy! Let's cowtie these, lickity-split!
These were supposed to be tied down last night! Why are-?!
Less talkin' and more lassoing, Captain!
INCOMING!
*BOOM*
That viper's bite lacked poison... everyone all right?! Captain, I hope you don't mind my tacklin' you like that.

Fields.MenuText: No worries. I may have a bruise or two, but it's better than being blown up.
You're kidding, right? The highlight of my day.
YOU DAMN LOOKOUTS! WHERE WERE YOUR EYES JUST BEFORE THEY FIRED ON US?!

Fields.DialogueText: Let me get a look at you, Captain!
Heh. You're a good sport, sheriff!
Scold the lookouts later, Captain! We gotta return fire and make a run for it!
... You look fine to me, but we'll get a doctor to check it out later. RETURN FIRE!
Yes, ma'am!
Time to turn the guns back on the snakes and blow them to kingdom come!
Agreed!
@BATTLE
Ah, look. The hero of the day!
Is this it, then, wolfshead? Do you finally have the courage to challenge me to my face?
Your meddling ends here, Count Badler! This land belongs to the people, not a warmongering maniac!

Fields.MenuText: And who keeps the people safe?! Who protects them when threats from outside nations loom?
Killing me will not cease their suffering! Freedom costs a high price to win AND maintain, Miss Locklet!
YOU are the traitor here, Miss Locklet! Raising a false army for motivations as personal as revenge!

Fields.DialogueText: A tyrant!
My family and our ancestral land being handed over to the enemy was NOT worth the price, Count Badler!
Ha. The peasants hold so much hatred for your treaty with the Keltic Empire, getting to this point was easy.
YOU KNOW NOTHING, CHILD! You eagerly raise your gun for freedom but do not understand the cost of maintaining it!
My family DIED for you, bastard! You sold away our land to the enemy when we had lived on it for generations!
Good! Good! Very good, Miss Arizona! Very passionate delivery that time!
Hee hee!
You think YOUR family were the only ones who had to make a sacrifice?! How single-minded are you, child?! You think I enjoy kneeling to the Kelts?!
In order to stop the war from ravaging our lands further we HAD to agree to some losses! They are an EMPIRE, while we are but grass that they step on!
I...! Is our pride not worth fighting to the death for?!
Good! Great job on that delivery, Miss Arizona! You're getting better and better each day!
I couldn't have done it without you, Captain!
You insolent cur! The people cannot see how easily we will fall to the Empire under your rule.
At least we will die with our heads held high. You would have made us little better than dogs, former Count Badler...
And that's where we'll end today. You sent chills down my very spine with that cold delivery, Miss Arizona.
It certainly helps that you were saying the lines as I wrote them down, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Morganas. Everyone's a critic.
Looks like those vipers really do have some tricks up their sleeves!
How did a fleet get this close without any warning?!
You think our wagon corral can handle such a force, Captain? I'm not opposed to falling back to meeting up with our reinforcements!

Fields.MenuText: We can take the odds, Miss Arizona! What's a battleship or three when they're nothing but Morgana scum?
Fall back! We take no chances riding this one out alone!
Thanks for the offer. I'm pretty sure you don't mean it, but your acting skills are definitely improving.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess it's time to pony up and show them who has the bigger guns in these parts, Captain!
Just means we gotta be a bit more clever is all!
Aw, shucks. Let's just sink these things and then you can compliment me some more.
@BATTLE
YEE HAW! Those uglies sure regret messing with us!
Good work on keeping them occupied, Miss Arizona.
Hey, now! We all did great work, I reckon!
Time to get the water pitcher filled and start handing out some well-deserved drinks to the townsfolk!
So, all of you are here to watch us cobble together some ideas?
You know it!
We do all of our writing on the deck, after all.
So what's your next play gonna be about?
Uh... well... Captain?

Fields.MenuText: How about we go back to the start and read some Edgar Allen Poe short stories? To give our minds a bit of a break.
How about we write an action story?
We'll figure that out when we settle on something we like.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! We should read The Raven this time, Captain!
Like?
Sounds like a plan!
Why not?
I'll go get the collection book from my cabin!
Maybe a story about an undercover agent?
Oo! That sounds like fun! Let's get writing!
All right!
What?! That's boring, Captain!
The creative process is harder than it looks, boys! Sometimes great ideas happen while you're in the process of writing. Right, Captain?
Indeed.
@BATTLE
Just as soon as we clear some breathing space...
So... Captain.
Yes, Miss Arizona?
I just wanted to thank you for taking me up as your apprentice for the theatre and approving of these talent shows. It means a great deal to the crew and myself.

Fields.MenuText: I want to support your dream in any way I can, Miss Arizona. I've... become quite fond of you.
It's a good morale booster for both the men on the ship and the dock workers. I would've been crazy to say no.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm so happy to hear you say that, Captain. I might never be completely comfortable on stage, but at least I can enjoy creating plays with you.
That's why I'm proud to be your friend. You do your best as sheriff to support the whole town and all the strangers who drift through these parts - and you ain't bad to your deputy, either.
Of course, Arizona.
Hmm. You know, some of these crowds might like a breather from the action. Maybe something romantic for our next one?
I'd... I'd like that, Captain. I'd like that a lot.
Well, the outlaws don't round themselves up.
And the songs don't write themselves, neither.
How's your choir voice?
Workin' on it, Cap. I reckon we'll make this war sound real pretty once all's said and done.
Got a story in mind?
A few. Let's pick one and see where it takes us.
